item.title: A study of political parties' election promises and voters' satisfication levels
item.description: Abstract This study investigated the importance of political parties to keep their election promises based on the 2019 Canadian Election Study survey data. It is found political parties which keep their election promises would have their voters with higher higher satisfication levels. This study recommend the political parties which want to win their elections should make their election promises carefully and sincerely. Introduction Elin Naurin already investigated the topic “political parties keep their election promises” in 2011[1], the study pointed out that it is important for political parties to keep their election promises.
